comments: Stewart (DET) gives Tatum (BOS) room to land on the jump shot attempt.
Joseph (DET) maintains a legal pivot foot.

As Grant (DET) goes up for his driving shot attempt at the rim, he makes marginal contact to the face of Tatum (BOS). However, does not lead unnaturally with his forearm and the contact is the result of a normal basketball move. Contact to an opponent?s head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Cunningham (DET) places a marginal arm on the hip of Brown (BOS) as the two players come off the screen. The marginal touch does not impact Brown's FOM away from the ball.
Bey (DET) reaches in a grazes the right arm of Horford (BOS) and the marginal contact does not impact the latter's SQBR.
White (BOS) establishes himself and is firming up while Cunningham (DET) moves towards the basket and initiates contact to his body during the drive.
Stewart (DET) briefly places and removes a hand from the front of White (BOS) during his drive to the basket. The marginal contact does not impact the driver's SQBR.
White (BOS) drives along the baseline and his left foot steps out of bounds. Possession is correctly awarded to Detroit.
Grant (DET) cuts to the basket and Tatum (BOS) meets the cutting player to engage and then disengage away from the ball.
White (BOS) makes direct contact with the ball to dislodge it from Cunningham (DET) during his shot attempt.
Horford (BOS) legally contests the hook shot from Stewart (DET) in the paint.
Cunningham (DET) and Brown (BOS) engage and disengage on the latter's cut to the middle of the paint.
Cunningham (DET) takes fewer than three steps after he has gathered the ball.
Stewart (DET) establishes himself in a legal screening position in the path of Brown (BOS) and the two players engage during the screen away from the ball.
Tatum (BOS) legally contests the turnaround shot attempt from Grant (DET).
Cunningham (DET) maintains a legal guarding position on Brown (BOS) during the drive and the contact is incidental.
Stewart (DET) makes direct contact with the ball during Brown's (BOS) driving shot attempt to the basket.
Cunningham (DET) and Tatum (BOS) engage and disengage as the former attempts to get open during the inbound play.
White (BOS) and Cunningham (DET) make simultaneous contact with the ball and White is able to recover the deflected pass.
Cunningham (DET) commits a take foul on White (BOS).
Tatum (BOS) extends his right arm out slightly as he disengages from Grant (DET) during the inbounds play. The marginal contact does not rise to the level of a foul.
Grant (DET) legally contests the jump shot attempt from Tatum (BOS).
